data.title: Best place to win
data.text: I know casinos are built on losers but I have to admit. I see more people win at 7th Street than anywhere else. Seem like I play longer and hit more often than any other place. It doesn't have the perks of some of the other casinos, but it's worth the trip because I win more at 7th Street.

data.title: Slum Casino in a Bad Part of Town
data.text: Okay, I have been to literally hundreds of casinos. I collect table chips, so when ever I see a casino while traveling, I stop in. And this one was near the bottom of the list of casino experiences. First, it is in a bad part of town, and we were not comfortable being in the area. And parking was tough. But we went inside anyway. The folks at the door were super nice and inviting. And that is the good parts of the review. We were hoping for tables, but this is a slots only casino. No bar, no food, but there was a free soft drink area (but your not allowed to take the drinks outside).  The rooms were dingy and old, carpet dirty and the clientele appeared local and looked shaky, just like the surrounding neighborhood. There are multiple floors with small rooms of slots machines. It was not clean or comfortable and there are no amenities besides the opportunity to play slots. The 5 of us each decided to play a little. I put a $20 bill in my machine and had ZERO payouts. Not even a cherry... My friends each had similar experiences. Seems the payout rate here is low.  Nothing to see here, move along.

data.title: Nice casino
data.text: It's definitely an interesting building. Several rooms and floors. Decent mix of machines. Decent staff. Right downtown.

data.title: Very unique, and lots of fun!!
data.text: We loved this place! It's in a former Masonic Temple, in a really interesting area, next to a park. There are three levels, and each one has numerous rooms, all filled with great slot machines.  We ended up staying for nearly three hours, which to us, is a fairly long stay. We never got bored, as there were slots of all denominations and types.  We actually walked away with some cash, and if we lived closer, we'd be regulars here!  The staff were really nice, too!!!

data.title: Crowded and a bunch of illegals!
data.text: Couldn't find a place to sit down, the number of illegals was amazing.. It was a mess and the air was either to hot or blowing cold..

data.title: average to below casino in downtown KC, KS across from courthouse; no tables of any kind
data.text: I am not really a casino type of person but got dragged here by a gambling addict friend of mine once. I found it mildly interesting, but not nearly as interesting as a "real casino." All there are here are slot machines of various types, many of which involve card "playing." If you're into that, they do have a nice variety of games. I don't recall drink prices now, but do remember they seemed reasonable. The machines seemed to pay out pretty well, as my friend on that day and other days, actually managed to win sizeable amounts (which he ended up giving back).  Compared to a real casino in Vegas, or even a Missouri River boat one offering table games, this place is a joke. But, if you want to gamble at a machine in this area, you could probably do a lot worse. I recall parking did not seem to be much of an issue, at least during the middle of a weekday.

data.title: no tables
data.text: This casino ONLY has slot machines, on all levels... No tables what so ever... no blackjack, no poker, and no craps......  I have never won anything at this casino but I have some friends that say they have really good luck here....

data.title: Best kept secret in the KC Metro Area
data.text:
Visiting the 7th Street Casino is an experience. It is owned by the Wyandotte Nation and is reported to be the loosest slots in the area, after watching for a while I would have to agree. It is a historic old Masonic Lodge converted to a 3 story casino. The interior is from a past era and has been maintained.
Now for the Secret; the Casino Café the casino offers daily specials i.e. Thursday it was Chicken Fried Steak, Corn, Mashed Potatoes and a Roll and butter for $4.95 with soft drinks or coffee included. A different special is offered every day for the same price. The food was very good and a good size portion. Can't beat it.
Parking is in any of the city parking lots and a Casino Shuttle carries you to the entrance and returns you to your car. You can call ahead and have the shuttle waiting by calling the 913-371-3500 phone number from your cell.
